newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain agrees to convert $50 mln of Morocco's debt.
newsitem.headline: Spain agrees to convert $50 mln of Morocco's debt.

text.p: Spain on Friday agreed that it would convert $50 million of Morocco's debt into private investment projects in the North African country, said a note from Spain's Economy Ministry.
Under the agreement, Spain will channel the money into fostering Spanish private investment in Morocco in an effort to ease Morocco's debt to Spain, estimated at $2 billion.
Spain's Economy Minister, Rodrigo Rato, also agreed with Morocco's Finance and Foreign Investment Minister, Mohamed Kabbj, to create a credit line for small and medium sized companies.
The credit line will total 6 billion pesetas and will come from Development Funds (FAD) destined for Morocco.
